text: Appia () was a town of ancient Phrygia, inhabited during Hellenistic, Roman, and Byzantine times. According to Pliny the Elder, it belonged to the conventus of Synnada. It became the seat of a bishop in the ecclesiastical province of Phrygia Pacatiana; no longer a residential bishopric, it remains a titular see of the Roman Catholic Church.Catholic Hierarchy Its site is located near Pınarcık in Asiatic Turkey. ==References== Category:Populated places in Phrygia Category:Former populated places in Turkey Category:Catholic titular sees in Asia Category:Roman towns and cities in Turkey Category:Populated places of the Byzantine Empire Category:History of Kütahya Province Category:Altıntaş District
title: Appia (Phrygia)
